quizzes.question: Type in the command used to update a table.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Updating Data[/h1]

The [b]UPDATE [/b]statement allows us to alter data in the table. 

The basic syntax of an UPDATE query with a WHERE clause is as follows:[code format="sql"][b]UPDATE [/b]table_name
[b]SET [/b]column1=value1, column2=value2, ...
WHERE condition;[/code]
You specify the column and its new value in a comma-separated list after the [b]SET [/b]keyword.
[note]If you omit the WHERE clause, [b]all[/b] records in the table will be updated![/note]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to update the ''students'' table by changing the university's value to ''Stanford'' if the student's name is ''John''.
[!raw!]
{0} students 
{1} university='Stanford'
{2} name='John';
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Updating Data[/h1]

Consider the following table called "Employees": [img id="2847" width="100%"]
To update John's salary, we can use the following query: [code format="sql"][b]UPDATE[/b] Employees 
[b]SET[/b] Salary=5000
[b]WHERE[/b] ID=1;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2848" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to update the ''name'' and ''age'' columns of the ''students'' table.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Updating Multiple Columns[/h1]

It is also possible to UPDATE [b]multiple columns[/b] at the same time by comma-separating them:[code format="sql"]UPDATE Employees 
SET Salary=5000, FirstName='Robert'
WHERE ID=1;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2849" width="100%"]
[note]You can specify the column order any way you like in the SET clause.[/note]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to delete a row from ''people'' in which the ids falls in the range of 5 to 10.
[!raw!]
{0} FROM people
{1} id>5 {2} id<10;
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Deleting Data[/h1]

The [b]DELETE [/b]statement is used to remove data from your table. DELETE queries work much like UPDATE queries.[code format="sql"]DELETE FROM table_name
WHERE condition; [/code]
For example, you can delete a specific employee from the table: [code format="sql"]DELETE FROM Employees
WHERE ID=1;[/code]
[b]Result: [/b][img id="2850" width="100%"]
[note]If you omit the WHERE clause, [b]all [/b]records in the table will be deleted!
The DELETE statement removes the data from the table permanently.[/note]
